tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
  id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  source_ip VARCHAR,
  destination_ip VARCHAR,
  port INTEGER,
  protocol VARCHAR
)

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR,
    destination_ip VARCHAR,
    protocol VARCHAR,
    packet_size INT
);

CREATE TABLE analysis_logs (
    analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT REFERENCES network_traffic_logs(log_id),
    analysis_type VARCHAR,
    analysis_result VARCHAR,
    analysis_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE network_traffic_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source_ip VARCHAR(255),
    destination_ip VARCHAR(255),
    protocol VARCHAR(50),
    log_message TEXT
)

CREATE TABLE network_devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name VARCHAR(255),
    device_type VARCHAR(50),
    ip_address VARCHAR(255),
    location VARCHAR(100)
)

CREATE TABLE traffic_analysis (
    analysis_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    log_id INT,
    analysis_result TEXT,
    FOREIGN KEY (log_id) REFERENCES network_traffic_logs(log_id)
)

CREATE TABLE network_devices (
    device_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_name TEXT,
    ip_address INET,
    mac_address MACADDR,
    location TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE network_logs (
    log_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    log_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    log_message TEXT,
    severity INT
);

CREATE TABLE traffic_logs (
    traffic_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    source_ip INET,
    destination_ip INET,
    packets_sent INT,
    packets_received INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE user_activities (
    activity_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    user_id INT,
    activity_type TEXT,
    activity_timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    details TEXT
);

CREATE TABLE network_status (
    status_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    device_id INT,
    status_code INT,
    status_description TEXT,
    status_timestamp TIMESTAMP
);
